titles.title: Mäṣḥafä ḫǝmamatihu wä-zena sǝqlätu lä-ʾIyäsus Krǝstos “Book of the Passion and Story of the Crucifixion of Jesus Christ” / Täʾamrä täzkarä motu lä-ʾIyäsus Krǝstos “Miracles Concerning the Commemoration of the Death of Jesus Christ” / Gädlä Täklä Maryam “Vita of Täklä Maryam (Mäbʿa Ṣǝyon)” / Miracles of the Saviour of the World worked by ʾabunä Täklä Maryam

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Mäṣḥafä ḫǝmamatihu wä-zena sǝqlätu lä-ʾIyäsus Krǝstos “Book of the Passion and Story of the Crucifixion of Jesus Christ” (fols. 2ra-54rb) I-1) Homily for Mäggabit (fols. 3ra-7ra) I-2) Homily for Miyazya (entitled Zena sǝqlätu lä-ʾǝgziʾǝnä ʾIyäsus Krǝstos “The Story of the Crucifixion of Our Lord Jesus Christ”) (fols. 7rb-15va) I-4) Homily for Gǝnbot (fols. 15va-17va) I-5) Homily for Säne (fols.17va-19rb) I-6) Homily for Ḥamle (fols. 19rb-21ra) I-7) Homily for Näḥase (fols. 21ra -25rb) I-8) Homily for Mäskäräm (fols. 25rb-27va) I-9) Homily for Ṭǝqǝmt (fols. 27va-30rb) I-10) Homily for Ḫǝdar (fols. 30rb-32ra) I-11) Homily for Taḫśas (fols. 32ra-34va) I-12) Homily for Ṭǝrr (fols. 34va-36vb) I-13) Homily for Yäkkatit (fols. 36vb-37va) II) Täʾamrä täzkarä motu lä-ʾIyäsus Krǝstos “Miracles Concerning the Commemoration of the Death of Jesus Christ” (fols. 37va-44ra) II-1) Miracle for Mäggabit (fols. 37va-39va) II-2) Miracle for Miyazya (fols. 39va-40rb) II-3) Miracle for Gǝnbot (fols. 40rb-41rb) II-4) Miracle for Säne (fols. 41rb-42va) II-5) Miracle for Ḥamle (fols. 42va-43vb) III) Gädlä Täklä Maryam “Vita of Täklä Maryam (Mäbʿa Ṣǝyon)” (fols. 44ra-70ra) IV) Miracles of the Saviour of the World worked by ʾabunä Täklä Maryam (fols. 70ra-71va) IV-1) How the saint healed a child with the swollen throat (fol. 70ra-va) IV-2) How ʾabunä Mäbʿa Ṣǝyon healed a sick child who was near death (fols. 70va-71rb) IV-3) About light that appeared over the dough from which the bread for the commemoration of the Saviour was made (fol. 71rb-71va)
Additiones 1-4.

donors.donor: The name of the original donor(s) was probably written in the erased part of Additio 1 and in the supplication formulas throughout the Ms. According to Additio 2, Zä-Śǝllase donated the Ms. to the church of ʾIyäsus (Gwaḥgot) in 1901/02. His name and the name of his wife Wälättä Rufaʾel are also written in the supplication formulas, over the erased name(s), in the same hand as Additio 2 (e.g., fols. 7ra, 32ra). Two other names, <...> Mikaʾel and his wife Ṣädalä Maryam, are added in some supplication formulas, in another secondary hand (e.g., fols. 25ra, 37va).

dcomments.dcomment: According to Additio 2, the Ms. was donated to the church of ʾIyäsus in 1894 year of mercy (= 1901/02 A.D.).

txstates.txstate: The Ms. is affected by humidity. The leather cover (hidden under the secondary textile cover) is probably for the most part missing; traces and remains of turn-ins are visible on the inner face of the front board and on the inner face of the back board, respectively. Holes are carefully amended on fols. 1, 2, 64.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered by reddish-brown leather (for the most part hidden under the secondary textile cover). Two pairs of sewing stations.

bnothers.bnother: Small holes are visible in the centrefold of the quires. The secondary textile cover is attached to the boards by means of recent synthetic threads.

squires.squire: A(2/fol. 1r-2v) – I(8/fols. 3r-10v) – II(8/fols. 11r-18v) – III(8/fols. 19r-26v) – IV(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 5; 6, stub after 2/fols. 27r-34v) – V(7; s.l.: 5, stub after 2/fols. 35r-41v) – VI(7; s.l.: 6, stub after 1/fols. 42r-48v) – VII(8/fols. 49r-56v) – VIII(8/fols. 57r-64v) – IX(8; s.l.: 1, stub after 8; 8, stub after 1/fols. 65r-72v).

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks (of slit-type) are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

rulings.ruling: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks (of slit-type) are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: The handwriting tends to right-sloping. The letters are slender and narrowly spaced.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; the name of the protagonist of Texts III and IV; a few groups of lines (alternating with black lines) on the incipit page of Text I; two lines of the incipit of Texts II-IV; one or two initial lines of the sections of Texts I-IV; elements of the punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals.

additional.det: The note is written in a mediocre hand. The part containing the name of the original donor and the receiving institution has been erased.
The note is written in a poor hand, the same as Additio 3. It states that Zä-Śǝllase and his wife Wälättä Rufaʾel donated the Ms. to the church of ʾIyäsus.

additional.cont: Fol. 72ra-b: Ownership note extended by a record concerning the construction of a church.
additional.det: The note is written in a poor hand, the same as Additio 2. It mentions that the donation of the Ms. and the construction of the church of the Saviour of the World (possibly in the vicinity of ʾIyäsus Gwaḥgot, s. D.NOSNITSIN, Churches and Monasteries of Tǝgray, Wiesbaden 2013, or in ʾAqaqi near Addis Ababa, s. GueCopMen, vol. 2, p. 524) took place in 1894 year of mercy (= 1901/02 A.D.), in the year of Mark the Evangelist, during the reign of King Mǝnilǝk II (r. 1889-1913), when the teacher was mämhǝr Wäldä ʿAbiyä ʾƎgziʿ and his assistant was ʾaläqa ʾAśrat.

additional.cont: Fol. 72v: Record concerning the acquisition of land and the introduction of a new tabot.
additional.det: The note is written in Amharic, in a mediocre hand. It states that there are four plots of land with sorghum donated by four individuals (mentioned by name) for (the commemoration of ?) the Saviour of the World. One of the plots should be allocated as a salary for a deacon. Subsequently, it contains a directive which requires that if a new tabot is introduced, it should be dedicated to St George.

extras.extra: - An unfinished (historiographic ?) note or pen trial, በዘመነ፡ ንጉሥነ፡ ቴዎድሮስ:... fol. 1r. - A note of several lines has been erased in fol. 72ra. - Pen trial: fol. 72ra. - Scribbles, writing exercises (part of Ethiopic syllabary), doodles: fols. 1r, 72rb, inner face of the front board.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - Monthly readings of Text I are indicated by the names of the months written, in the main hand, in the upper margin: ዘመጋቢት: fol. 3r ዘሚያዝያ: fol. 7r ዘግንቦት: fol. 15v ዘሰኔ: fol. 17v ዘሐምሌ: fols. 19r ዘነሐሴ: fol. 21r ዘመስከረም: fol. 25r ዘጥቅምት: fol. 27v ዘኅዳር: fol. 30r ዘታህሳስ: fol. 32r ዘጥር: fol. 34v ዘየካቲት: fol. 36v - Monthly readings of Texts II-IV are indicated by the names of the months written, in a secondary hand, in the upper margin: የመጋቢት: fol. 37va ዘሚያዝያ: fol. 39va ዘግንቦት: fol. 40rb ዘሰኔ: fol. 41rb ዘሐምሌ: fol. 42va ዘነሐሴ: fol. 44ra ዘመስከረም: fol. 48va ዘጥቅምት: fol. 56va ዘኅዳር: fol. 61va ዘታህሳስ: fol. 65ra ዘጥር: fol. 70ra ዘየካቲት: fol. 70va.

miniature.details: Cp. D.NOSNITSIN, Churches and Monasteries of Tǝgray, Wiesbaden 2013, p. 221-222.
